Prompt:
Example 1:
In a village dwelt a poor old woman, who had gathered together a dish of beans and wanted to cook them. So she made a fire on her hearth, and that it might burn the quicker, she lighted it with a handful of straw. When she was emptying the beans into the pan, one dropped without her observing it, and lay on the ground beside a straw, and soon afterwards a burning coal from the fire leapt down to the two. Then the straw began and said: ‘Dear friends, from whence do you come here?' The coal replied: ‘I fortunately sprang out of the fire, and if I had not escaped by sheer force, my death would have been certain, I should have been burnt to ashes.' The bean said: ‘I too have escaped with a whole skin, but if the old woman had got me into the pan, I should have been made into broth without any mercy, like my comrades.' ‘And would a better fate have fallen to my lot?' said the straw.

Example 2:
From the lathe, the veneer is passed to the cutting table, where it is cut to lengths and widths as desired. It is then conveyed to the second story, where it is placed in large dry rooms, air tight, except as the air reaches them through the proper channels. The veneer is here placed in crates, each piece separate and standing on edge. The hot air is then turned on. This comes from the sheet iron furnace attached to the boiler in the engine room below, and is conveyed through large pipes regulated by dampers for putting on or taking off the heat. There is also a blower attached which keeps the hot air in the dry rooms in constant motion, the air as it cools passing off through an escape pipe in the roof, while the freshly heated air takes its place from below. These rooms are also provided with a net-work of hot air pipes near the floor. The temperature is kept at about 165°, and so rapid is the drying process that in the short space of four hours the green log from the steam box is shaved, cut, dried, packed, and ready for shipment.

Using vocabulary and structure from examples, write a short paragraph about 'nutrition' targeting the same readability level (Middle School), limited to 200 words. 

The seeds of various fruits and vegetables have a protective coat that safeguards them until they reach the earth. When they sprout, they use this energy to grow into strong and healthy plants. However, if they were to be eaten before being planted, they would be vulnerable to diseases and pests that could harm their development. In the same way, a human body needs a balanced diet to stay healthy. The right foods provide the necessary nutrients to build strong muscles, support the immune system, and maintain a healthy mind. Just like the seeds that need time to grow, our bodies need time to absorb the nutrients from the food we eat. This process is called digestion, and it allows our bodies to extract the necessary energy and nutrients to function properly. Eating a variety of foods helps to ensure that our bodies receive all the necessary nutrients, keeping us strong and healthy. By taking care of our diet, we can promote overall well-being and live a long, healthy life.​

'Yes,' said the girl, 'because if I had eaten that pizza, I would have been lazy, and my energy would have been low. I want to feel happy and healthy, so I choose to eat fruits and vegetables.' 'You are making a good choice,' said the friend. 'They are good for your body, and you will feel full of energy.'

When we don't eat enough food or the right types of food, our bodies may suffer from malnutrition, leading to health problems. When food is consumed, it travels through the digestive system to be broken down into energy and nutrients. Foods such as fruits, vegetables, and whole grains are rich in vitamins and minerals that are essential for growth and development. They are also high in fiber, which helps to regulate bowel movements. On the other hand, foods high in sugar and fat can be detrimental to health if consumed excessively. The bean said: ‘I too have escaped with a whole skin, but if the old woman had got me into the pan, I should have been made into broth without any mercy, like my comrades.' ‘And would a better fate have fallen to my lot?' said the straw.

Example 2:
From the lathe, the veneer is passed to the cutting table, where it is cut to lengths and widths as desired. It is then conveyed to the second story, where it is placed in large dry rooms, air tight, except as the air reaches them through the proper channels. The veneer is here placed in crates, each piece separate and standing on edge. The hot air is then turned on. This comes from the sheet iron furnace attached to the boiler in the engine room below, and is conveyed through large pipes regulated by dampers for putting on or taking off the heat. There is also a blower attached which keeps the hot air in the dry rooms in constant motion, the air as it cools passing off through an escape pipe in the roof, while the freshly heated air takes its place from below. These rooms are also provided with a net-work of hot air pipes near the floor. The temperature is kept at about 165°, and so rapid is the drying process that in the short space of four hours the green log from the steam box is shaved, cut, dried, packed, and ready for shipment.

Proper nutrition is the fuel for our bodies. Just as a car needs gasoline to run, our bodies need the right food to function properly. A diet rich in fruits, vegetables, and whole grains will give you the energy you need to get through your day. Without proper nutrition, our bodies can become sluggish, weak, and prone to illness. Just like the straw that escaped the fire, we too can avoid being ‘burnt to ashes’ by making healthy choices. We can choose to eat nutritious foods, stay hydrated, and exercise regularly. This will keep our bodies running smoothly and our minds sharp. By fueling our bodies with the right foods, we can stay healthy and strong, just like the bean that avoided being made into broth. By making these simple choices, we can live a happy and healthy life. Our bodies are like a machine that needs the right fuel to run properly. With proper nutrition, we can keep our bodies running like a well-oiled machine.

Using vocabulary and structure from examples, write a short paragraph about 'nutrition' targeting the same readability level (Middle School), limited to 200 words. 
The nutritious food we eat provides the body with the energy and materials it needs to function and grow. A healthy diet is essential for maintaining a strong immune system, preventing diseases, and promoting overall well-being. A balanced meal should include a variety of foods from different groups, such as fruits, vegetables, whole grains, lean proteins, and healthy fats. These foods provide the body with the necessary nutrients, including vitamins, minerals, and fiber, which are vital for optimal health. Fruits and vegetables are rich in antioxidants, which help protect the body from damage caused by free radicals. Whole grains, on the other hand, provide sustained energy and fiber, which can help lower cholesterol levels and promote digestive health. Eating a nutritious diet is crucial for maintaining a healthy body and mind. By making informed food choices, individuals can take control of their health and well-being.

Using vocabulary and structure from examples, write a short paragraph about 'nutrition' targeting the same readability level (Middle School), limited to 200 words. 

Food and water are essential for our bodies to function properly. Nutrition plays a crucial role in giving us the energy we need to live. It is the process by which our bodies convert the food we eat into energy. Just like the straw, coal, and bean in the village, our bodies are made up of different components that need to be nourished to keep us healthy. Our brains need glucose to function properly, our muscles need protein to grow and repair, and our bodies need fiber to keep our digestive system running smoothly. If we don't get the right nutrients, our bodies can suffer the consequences. The old woman might have cooked the bean into a tasty meal, but if she didn't provide enough nutrients, the bean would have been left feeling weak and tired. Just like the bean, we need to make sure we get the right balance of nutrients to stay healthy and strong. A well-balanced diet is the key to good nutrition.
